Generate random numbers

Source: R/prng_interface.R
generatePRNG.Rd

Generates random numbers using the current PRNG configuration. The distribution type and parameters are determined by the current configuration set with createPRNG() or updatePRNG().

Usage

generatePRNG(n)

Arguments

n

Number of random numbers to generate

Value

Numeric vector of length n with values from the configured distribution

Details

Thread safety: This function is fully thread-safe and will block until mutex is acquired. When use_threading=TRUE is set in the configuration, it uses thread-local storage for improved performance in multi-threaded environments.

Examples

# Create default PRNG (uniform 0-1)
createPRNG()

# Generate 5 uniform random numbers
generatePRNG(5)
#> [1] 0.9011776 0.1728031 0.3237417 0.7336109 0.8130025

# Switch to normal distribution
updatePRNG(list(distribution = "normal", normal_mean = 0, normal_sd = 1))

# Generate 5 normally distributed random numbers
generatePRNG(5)
#> [1]  0.33170691  0.12515588  0.05401223 -0.71550680  0.39064201
